metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7170 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: ntpd in ntp 4.2.x before 4.2.8p7 and 4.3.x before 4.3.92 allows authenticated users that know the private symmetric key to create arbitrarily-many ephemeral associations in order to win the clock selection of ntpd and modify a victim's clock via a Sybil attack. This issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-1549.

criterions.comment: ntp package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p11+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
